info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 2:13PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cabarrus, southeastern Mecklenburg and northeastern Union Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 213 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Uptown Charlotte, or near Mint Hill, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroe, East Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Stallings, Unionville, Lake Park, Hemby Bridge and Reedy Creek Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
